item.title: Holly add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Well, I don't like your clothes. You look perfectly ridiculous in them. Why on earth don't you go up and change? It's perfectly childish to be in mourning for a man who is actually staying a whole week with you in your house as a guest. I call it grotesque." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Holly add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "One should always eat muffins quite calmly. It is the only way to eat them." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Holly add a quote by Charles Darwin
item.description: "Thus, from the war of nature, from famine and death, the most exalted object which we are capable of conceiving, namely, the production of the higher animals, directly follows. There is grandeur in this view of life, with its several powers, having been originally breathed into a few forms or into one; and that, whilst this planet has gone cycling on according to the fixed law of gravity, from so simple a beginning endless forms most beautiful and most wonderful have been, and are being, evolved." -- Charles Darwin

item.title: Holly add a quote by Henrik Ibson
item.description: "There those you love and those who you'd rather just be with..." -- Henrik Ibson
